message: The new law laid out clear criteria to charge traffickers, including threatening harm, seizing victims’ personal property or holding them in servitude to pay off a debt, along with 10 other factors. This represents a significant change in how the state handles human trafficking cases

data.description: Prosecutors in Pennsylvania have charged dozens of people for human trafficking since a tougher law took effect in 2014.
data.title: Dozens Convicted Under PA’s Tougher Human Trafficking Law
